Job Description

We are seeking a .NET Developer Intern to assist in the development process for building .NET applications using ASP.NET, C#, and JavaScript. A Developer Intern would be responsible for parts of the development, integration, and implementation of features of the software, as well as the R&D research and documentation aspects that come with the project. As part of this internship, you’ll learn how to develop and test code efficiently while gaining real world experience working on applications that support our customers. With mentoring from Senior Developers, the intern will learn multiple systems and be able to use their skills in multiple projects and maintenance, and coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.

What can you expect from us?

We offer a rewarding paid internship program that will provide valuable experiences to enhance your college career.

  • Competitive hourly wage and flexible hours (flex time)
  • Hands on learning experience from industry professionals
  • Ability to continue internship into the schoolyear, should your schedule allow, and should there be a continued need in the team
  • An opportunity to test and grow your skills in a corporate setting
  • Opportunity to gain full time employment post-graduation
  • Convenient location at 270 & 315 in Worthington.
  • Right next to the Olentangy Park trail and river (great for lunchtime walks or walk-and-talk meetings)
  • Gain knowledge and experience in the following topics/areas: Object-Oriented Programming Principles (OOP), Design Standards, .NET, ASP.NET, C#, Web Forms, SQL, JavaScript, Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Agile/Waterfall Software Development, server design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC)), and general Server-Side Development (e.g. ASP.Net, SQL Server, Oracle, PHP)

Responsibilities

Depending on current project needs, responsibilities could entail any of the following:

  • Translate application storyboards and use cases into architecture concepts and pseudocode
  • Help design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C# code by writing clean, scalable code using Object Oriented Programming Principles (OOP) and our defined Development Standards guide
  • Help ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications by identifying any observed bottlenecks and bugs, and suggesting solutions / technical alternatives to mitigate and address these issues; Make recommendations towards the development of new code or reuse of existing code, and improve/streamline processes and systems
  • Support projects through entire Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) by participating in the requirements analysis and research gathering (R&D) process, and/or writing documentation such as technical specifications, user guides, and other forms of documentation.
  • Interact with team members (end-users, testers, distributors, analysts and project/release managers) in a team-oriented fashion
  • Follow software development methodologies and best practices
  • Assist in system improvements and bug fixing; Track support ticket progress, and ensure tickets are successfully implemented through following up with developers and QA team.

Requirements

The Developer Intern must be currently enrolled at an accredited university pursuing a degree in a related field of study, and be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience (either through in an internship, previous employment, or in a college project):

  • Must be enrolled as a student at an accredited college or university, with at least sophomore status, OR 2+ years of the following: equivalent training or education (technical schools, coding bootcamps, etc.), and/or relevant full-time/contract work.
  • Additional 2+ years of cumulative programming/relevant experience, such as contracting, internships/previous employment, and/or online publishing via open-source collaboration.
  • Familiarity with the .NET framework, and proven experience developing C#/.NET scripts, programs, or applications
  • Knowledge of Visual Studio development environment, or similar integrated development environment (IDE)
  • Basic familiarity with GIT, Subversion, or similar version control systems.
  • Basic understanding of Design Patterns and Object-Oriented Concepts.
  • Experience or familiarity with the software development lifecycle (SDLC), including requirements analysis, development, production deployment and maintenance; Experience or understanding of working in an Agile environment.
  • Experience or familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, Server design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC)), and general Server-Side Development (e.g. ASP.Net, SQL Server, Oracle, PHP) is a definite PLUS.
  • Experience with HTML/CSS, JSON Requests, and Responsive Web Development is a definite PLUS.
  • Experience in other languages such as JavaScript or Mobile based (Objective-C, Java, Swift, etc.) is a definite PLUS.
  • Working knowledge of MS Office products
  • Ability to function well in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
  • Ability to write technical documentation for internal or external developer/technical audiences.
  • Applicant must possess good written and spoken English language skills (fluent or conversant in English).
  • US Citizen, capable of gaining a security clearance preferred.

Cadence Design Systems is seeking a highly motivated graduate student for internship in the Product Engineering team. The Cadence Digital and Signoff Group will offer you a dynamic environment in which you will work with innovative R&D and Customer Engagement teams to influence the development of software tools for advanced chip design platforms.

Position Responsibilities

  • Designing, developing, troubleshooting and debugging software programs on Unix/Linux platforms
  • Supporting Customers in performing successful tapeouts of their System-on-chip designs

Applied BioMath is seeking an intern to support data mining and build database management framework using chemical databases for large/small molecules in the area of drug research. The candidate for this role as
Intern – Bioinformatics/Chemoinformatics Scientist should have a strong background in chemistry or related scientific field, as well as experience in programming in database query languages and scientific languages like python/R. The candidate will work in a collaborative environment, where he/she will also assist on R&D projects using local and cloud-based development environments to perform the analysis. The candidate is expected to be aware and up to date with scientific literature and changing technologies.

Duties and Responsibilities:

This position is responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

  • Work with chemical databases/resources to develop interaction databases to aid in the discovery and design of drug molecules
  • Assist and perform bioinformatic analyses for R&D projects
  • Familiarity with medicinal chemistry or large molecule 2D/3D descriptors (fingerprints, SMILES, molecular graphs, etc.).
  • Experience with chemoinformatic and bioinformatic tools and libraries, including preliminary and advanced AI/machine learning algorithms for end-to-end data analysis
  • Strong scientific programming skills, and expertise with pipeline tools.
  • Effectively interpret and communicate analysis results in a timely manner
  • Participate in scientific discussions

Qualifications, Skills and Abilities:

  • Currently pursuing Masters or Ph.D. degree Chemistry, Computational Chemistry, Cheminformatics, or related quantitative field
  • Knowledge of statistics, machine learning/deep learning is a plus
  • Proficiency with statistical programming languages (Python, R) and database query languages in Linux environment

Work Environment and Physical Requirements:

  • General office environment
  • May work remotely, or in either our Concord, MA or Pleasanton, CA office

If interested, please email careers@appliedbiomath.com to apply.

Applied BioMath (www.appliedbiomath.com) is a rapidly growing, people-focused, organization that uses innovative modeling and simulation approaches to revolutionize drug invention and accelerate drug development for cutting-edge therapeutics. We have a fit-for-purpose philosophy and our projects are specifically designed to answer the unique needs of each individual client. From systems models that integrate disease pathophysiology with therapeutic mechanisms of action to population pharmacokinetic models to complex exposure-response models and model-based meta analyses, we offer a comprehensive suite of modeling and simulation services combined with strategic drug development support. Our analyses have assisted both large and small pharma and biotechs to: prioritize portfolios, identify knowledge gaps, prioritize and design experiments, predict optimal drug properties, and support clinical trials and indication/patient selection. Our results have reduced costs and accelerated timelines of drug invention. We work closely with drug program teams, scientists, program managers, protein engineers, and chemists, as well as senior managers, to best affect the outcome of drug programs in research, development, and clinical trials. We are frequently thought of as a member of the project team.

At Applied BioMath, our passion for science, technology, and helping patients is what drives our desire to revolutionize drug invention. Our team members are innovators and entrepreneurs at heart, and enjoy pioneering this paradigm shift of how drug invention is done. We love to learn, challenge ourselves and others, and create new science and opportunities. Scientists and all team members at Applied Biomath have the rare opportunity to work across therapeutic areas on treatments ranging from traditional small molecules and monoclonal antibodies to the most innovative modalities, like gene therapies, cell-based therapies, conditionally active therapeutics, antibody-drug conjugates, bispecific and multispecific antibodies, prodrugs, protein degraders, RNA-based therapies - here, you’ll see it all! As a member of our team, you’ll be on the forefront of drug discovery and development in an exciting, collaborative environment that supports your growth as a leader. We offer challenging projects and opportunities for development combined with comprehensive benefits and flexible work arrangements that help you balance your professional and personal lives. If interested in joining our team, please send your CV/resume and cover letter to careers@appliedbiomath.com.

Applied BioMath is an equal opportunity employer; we take pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive environment. We will not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotions or any other employment practices on the basis of age, color, disability, gender identity, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law. If you are a candidate in need of assistance or accommodation in the application process, please contact peopleservices@appliedbiomath.com.

GC Image, LLC, seeks applicants for student internships in scientific
software development. We understand that academic studies requires
flexible scheduling, so the internships have flexible working hours of 10-20
hours per week and our offices are conveniently located in the heart of
the Haymarket District. We also have full-time positions after graduation.

GC Image is a global leader in software for multidimensional
chromatography and mass spectrometry. Our scientific software has
advanced tools for multidimensional/multispectral data visualization,
processing, analysis, and informatics. We have customers in countries
throughout Europe, North and South America, East and Southeast Asia
and Australia, South Asia, South Africa, and the Arabian Gulf.

object-oriented programming language (preferably Java). A background

Position Summary: EN-POWER GROUP, founded in 2003, is an engineering firm that designs, develops, and delivers comprehensive and integrated energy solutions for any building type, from concept to completion. As a growing company, EN-POWER GROUP aims to provide a collaborative working environment and supports employees’ professional development by helping them pursue their technical interests through diverse hands-on experiences. Our team, composed of engineers, energy managers, analysts, and sustainability experts, focuses on energy efficiency and resiliency in order to strengthen long-term facility planning and maximize project payback.

This internship is based in our Midtown Manhattan office and is the ideal opportunity for students or recent graduates to gain valuable hands-on experience in energy management, building science, and lighting systems.

As an Energy Analyst and Field Intern, you will support lead energy engineers and auditors in the design, development, and evaluation of energy efficiency measures. You will develop an understanding of building HVAC, DHW, lighting, mechanical, and envelope systems. Your day-to-day will be to assist with building site visits, technical data entry, and energy modeling and calculations.

Principal Accountabilities:

  • Collect data during on-site inspections to document existing systems and associated equipment
  • Write/draft energy efficiency reports including ASHRAE Level I and II audit reports, and Local Law 87 Compliance reports
  • Assist lead engineers/auditors in the field to conduct energy audits and site assessments of building systems to evaluate energy usage and identify energy conservation measures (ECMs)
  • Assist with feasibility, energy savings, and cost-benefit financial analyses for potential ECMs
  • Create energy use analyses of building systems using analytical tools to help develop energy management plans and building-wide energy reduction plans
  • Assist lead engineers/auditors with testing and retro-commissioning of building systems to ensure compliance with Federal, State, and local laws (e.g., Local Law 87)

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Other Job Requirements:

  • Pursuing or recently received a degree in engineering, environmental science/studies, or other relevant technical field
  • Interest in HVAC systems, renewable energy systems, and energy efficiency concepts
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office with significant expertise in Excel
  • Certified as OSHA-10 within 6 months of employment per EN-POWER GROUP’s training program
  • Possess ability to perform physical tasks including but not limited to: Standing, walking, and sitting for extended periods of time, reading and recording information on handwritten forms and computer screens, using hand tools (such as powered tools, measuring devices, etc.), lifting and carrying up to 25 pounds, navigating in small/enclosed places, climbing stairs and ladders, and working in loud, warm and cold environments
  • Travel primarily within New York City

Required Personal Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated passion for energy efficiency and clean energy technology
  • Collaborative personality, strong team player
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
  • Self-motivation, attention to detail, and ability to multitask
  • Demonstrated enthusiasm for learning
  • Proven ability to work independently and within in a team environment, and to proactively identify problems and solutions

Benefits:

  • Pre-tax Travel & Phone Stipend
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Additional Benefits include: Company Activities, Lunch & Learns

About EN-POWER GROUP

With a mission of providing practical solutions to clients’ energy problems, EN-POWER GROUP was founded in May 2003 to be an engineering firm that designs, develops, and delivers comprehensive and integrated energy solutions for any building type, from concept to completion.


EN-POWER GROUP is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company Overview

Integrand Software, Inc. makes software for designing high frequency, RF and mixed signal complex integrated circuits (ICs) for the semiconductor industry. Our electromagnetic (EM) simulation tool, EMX®, allows designers to simulate large RF circuit blocks, characterize the behavior of passive components and analyze the parasitics due to interconnect. More than 50 companies rely on EMX to verify their ICs. The world’s major foundries use EMX to develop passive component models for their process design kits.

Position Description

The intern will help develop and enhance Integrand’s EMX. Responsibilities will include software development and creating new applications for the software. A successful candidate will have a strong software and algorithms background. Experience in numerical and scientific computation, electromagnetics and electrical engineering and IC design is desired.

Responsibilities

  • Develop new features for EMX
  • Debug test cases with accuracy, performance, capacity, or functional issues

Requirements

  • Masters or higher degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics or similar
  • Detailed knowledge of C++
  • Experience in parallel programming
  • Experience with Perl, shell scripts, Matlab and the Linux command line environment.
  • Provide access to non-proprietary code samples

Desirable

  • Experience developing software, preferably in the EDA domain
  • Knowledge of numerical methods and an understanding of integral equation techniques and non-linear optimization
  • Programming experience in Cadence’s SKILL extension language or LISP/Scheme
  • Experience with OpenCL/CUDA for programming GPUs
  • Experience with using Cadence tools for layout and simulation of IC designs
  • Understanding of analog/mixed-signal circuits
  • Knowledge of passive and active device modeling

Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee.

You will also be working as a full-stack website application developer in our Product development department and closely with the marketing and design departments and times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the designing of the company's various software products. We are looking for someone who is very positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”.

You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, maintain clean, and clever Mean Stack codes
  • Work with the popular CMS WordPress
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of web applications
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
  • Work with the company's AI department and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the company’s web applications
  • Apply understandings of web and mobile web app (Mean Stack)
  • Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the web applications
  • You will spend a lot of your time building web apps, efficiently coding in Mean Stack. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes
  • Work with the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools
  • Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management
  • Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts
  • Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable.

Requirements

  • You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts
  • Previous experience with javascript, Angular, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and Java
  • Previous working experience with WordPress.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of web development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning
  • Developing proficiency in Angular (v7 or higher), Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, Git, Postman, GitHub, AWS, PHP, Laravel, Rest/Restful, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build our web apps.

Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Business Unit Overview

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. Opportunity Overview

The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily
  • Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
  • Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
  • Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
  • Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
  • Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials
  • You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
  • You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
  • You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills
  • You love games and have checked out our current title
  • You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
  • You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

But Wait, There’s More!

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources

Sony AI is seeking highly motivated, self-driven individuals with expertise in AI Ethics - specifically Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability (FTA). We are looking for smart, enthusiastic people who want to research, develop, and deploy FTA technology for real-world applications in various business areas.

Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to research projects in AI ethics, especially around Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability.

  • Work closely with a team of AI researchers and programmers in the U.S., Switzerland, and Japan on ambitious AI projects.

  • Investigate new algorithms to solve fundamental AI ethics problems.

  • Write code to support research, usually in Python, C++, and/or R.

  • Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences.

  • Write papers for and give presentations at academic conferences.

Qualifications:

  • Passion to develop cutting-edge AI ethics technology and deploy it through a multi-stakeholder approach.

  • Background in Machine Learning, ideally a current PhD student. Progress toward a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related subjects is preferred, but we also welcome interdisciplinary researchers from other departments.

  • Experience in research on algorithmic fairness, accountability, and transparency, especially around detecting and mitigating bias in computer vision technologies, developing privacy-preserving technologies, and causal inference.

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills, including the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Sony AI America, a branch of Sony AI, is a remotely distributed organization spread across the U.S. and Canada. Sony AI is Sony’s new research organization pursuing the mission to use AI to unleash human creativity. Sony AI works closely with Sony’s other business units, including Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC., Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc., and Sony Music Entertainment. With some 900 million Sony devices in hands and homes worldwide today, a vast array of Sony movies, television shows and music, and the PlayStation Network, Sony creates and delivers more entertainment experiences to more people than anyone else on earth. To learn more: https://ai.sony/

NVIDIA's deep learning platform has already made a major impact to the field and is broadly used across leading academic institutions, start-ups, and industry, including the world’s largest Internet companies. We need passionate, hard-working and creative people to help us dive into more of these rare opportunities of GPU application in consumer and enterprise solution space.

We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern to join the NVIDIA Applications Engineering team to work as a full stack Web Developer and write Electron-based native applications for customer tools. This is a highly technical engineering support role that is responsible for providing best-in-class application support to NVIDIA's internal and external customers. Skills required include front-end development, back-end development and agile engineering practices. If you are someone who has superb technical and interpersonal skills to capture customer requirements, develop and deploy applications, this is the role for you! Join our dynamic team today!

What you'll be doing:

  • You will be responsible for the entire development cycle from design, development, testing and deployment of NVIDIA customer tools and internal website.

  • Help with writing clean, reusable ReactJS components for front-end website and native applications using Electron framework.

  • Work on new feature development along with architecting backend APIs in Rails (SQL) or Node (MongoDB).

  • Directly with internal and multi-functional teams to collect requirements on new features, outline proposals and drive development to closure.

  • Track bugs, take ownership and see them through to resolution.

  • We are seeking a motivated individual who is comfortable working independently in a dynamic agile development environment.

What we need to see:

  • Pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or Engineering field.

  • You should be fluent in JavaScript (ES6), and scripting languages such as Ruby or Python.

  • Have a deep understanding of full stack web development and have past experience with technologies such as React and Redux.

  • Experience with both PostgreSQL and NoSQL (Mongodb), including crafting efficient RESTful API queries.

  • Professional-level interpersonal skills, including your ability to adjust your communication to the technical level of the audience.

  • An innate capability to accurately and succinctly communicate procedures, results, and recommendations to customers.

  • Understanding of Agile Software / SCRUM Development practices and Git version control system.

  • Elicits, analyzes, documents and validates the System requirements for a development project

  • Functional Safety and Cybersecurity definition support.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Applied Software Inc., which is also known as MagView, is a growing proprietary health software company that has a stable track record of growth in its niche market. We deliver quality software solutions to hospitals and breast centers across the nation that help save lives. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, an independent worker, and polished along with having good communication skills. A positive attitude with the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced and fluid work environment is imperative for this role. Strong attention to detail, flexibility, and interpersonal astuteness are key factors for the position.

THE ROLE

This intern will be immersed in the environment of a professional health software firm and see what it is like to work in an office environment. You will help by providing programming support to the development group. Applicants should have excellent analytical and math skills with the ability to work in teams. We are looking for students majoring in Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics ideally.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Develop software as assigned (coding/programming).
  • Document/create/maintain automation tests, performance tests, procedures, records, and data.
  • Strong communication, documentation, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
  • Help analyze and diagnose performance, functional software, and customer issues.
  • Work closely with development engineers during product development life cycles and be involved in early field trials of release candidates.
  • Work with development team members to understand and communicate defects.
  • Flexibility to move across projects as needed.
  • Documentating and testing new software functionality.
Experience & Skills Requirements
  • Ability to write well-documented code (C#, Java, or other OO Language) and provide detailed user and developer documentation.
  • Ability to write comprehensive defect reports.
  • Ability to create and maintain testing data.
  • Ability to create and adhere to test design standards.
  • Excellent customer service orientation and teamwork skills.
  • Must have a working knowledge of client/server environments and personal computer hardware and software.
  • Experience with MS SQL preferred.
  • Experience in problem resolution support, system analysis, healthcare IT, or HL7 preferred.
  • Excellent customer service orientation and teamwork skills.
  • Positive, serving attitude with enthusiasm and passion that infects every call, meeting, and room you join.
MAJORS
  • Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics.
Salary Range:

This is a flexible schedule, paid internship opportunity with pay that is commensurate with experience. We are looking for someone who is looking to grow in to full time development opportunity. Please include salary requirement with your resume.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Imagine a work world where people love the mission at work and like their team. The environment is pretty fast-paced with lots of continued learning required for all positions. We are a fun, diverse group, who happens to work at a fun software company that has a serious mission. We affect patient care in a positive way every day, which leaves you feeling like you accomplished something positive. We like laughter as it creates a bond that brings others together. Creativity, intuition, and flexibility are key to the successful operation of organizations today, and we try and foster that here.

Typical tasks may include performance/data analysis, prototype construction, solid modeling, application engineering, part change notice processing, customer print reviews/reviewing and understanding customer needs and expectations.

Responsibilities

In addition, the candidate will assist engineers in preparing product specifications/drawings (conceptualizing and designing cost effective solutions), product performance testing, preparing technical reports, documentation, and project coordination in support of the design engineer/product leader. The candidate must have flexibility, creativity, and enthusiasm to solve challenging problems in a team environment. Join Our Team Opportunities may be as follows depending on department.
  • Engineering and Design: You will assist engineers in the development, design, manufacturing, and testing of products for LORD. Typical tasks may include performance/data analysis, prototype construction, application engineering, part change notice processing, customer print reviews/reviewing and understanding customer needs and expectations, preparing product specifications/drawings (conceptualizing and designing cost effective solutions), product performance testing, preparing technical reports, documentation, and project coordination in support of the design engineer/product leader.
  • Quality: You may assist with planning, coordinating, and completing broadly defined quality engineering tasks, assignments or small projects to ensure compliance with customer technical expectations. You may work with Black Belt on Global Process Improvement projects utilizing Six Sigma DMAIC process. You may also assist with completion of gap analysis for new requirements, aid in management of audit data and closure, provide data analysis or investigation in projects and provide backup and improvement measures in technical spec review.
  • Engineering Test Lab: You will assist engineers in the development and testing of products for LORD mechanical applications. You will work on testing methods and processes to gain a better understanding of machinery, fixtures, and measurement methods as well as assist with mechanical assembly and gain experience in troubleshooting techniques. Typical activities associated with this position may include CAD modeling, test machining commission/troubleshooting, engineering data analysis, validation of machine and test parameters, and customer/supplier interaction.
  • Manufacturing: Assignments may include a variety of mechanical related tasks including working with the manufacturing engineers on shop floor execution, cost saving initiatives, troubleshooting, quality improvements, manufacturing instructions, etc. Typical tasks could also include data entry, computer analysis, researching potential vendors for new components or materials, application engineering, part change notice processing, customer print reviews/reviewing and understanding customer needs and expectations. You may also triage incoming technical questions and provide for LORD customers, as well as assist with documentation review.

The company has operations in 49 countries around the world. JOB SUMMARY:
The NC Programming Intern will assist in creating NC programs for cutting and punching materials in the fabrication department. The main objective of this role is to create NC programs in a timely manner to keep the fabrication department on schedule and keep CNC machines operating to cut and punch parts for various facilities. The NC Programming Intern will work closely with the production supervisors, team leaders, design engineers, quality control, and materials management to ensure that product, process and procedural changes are implemented smoothly.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.

  • Clean up extraneous data from CAD drawings and save in format for input to nesting software to maintain a more efficient part library function.

  • Apply correct tooling for punched parts, placing tabs to hold part in sheet. Apply correct cutting paths to laser and waterjet parts placing tabs to hold part in sheet.

  • Perform nesting of parts, ensuring efficiency of part placement in material sheets; create NC programs for parts too large for nesting or requiring special tooling such as louvers.

  • Compare order revision to part library revision and update as needed to match manufacturing order; verify part is correctly routed to fabrication machines.

  • Ensure that NC programs are delivered to fabrication department before scheduled start date to ensure fabrication stays on schedule and deliver parts in time for next operation.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Student working towards an Associate’s degree for entire duration of internship.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • GPA of 3.0 or greater

Republic Wireless is reinventing the telecom industry, and now you have the opportunity to learn and grow with us. Take the next step in your career and apply!

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Analyze requirements to determine the feasibility and architecture of proposed projects and solutions, including risk assessment and simple project estimation.
  • Participate in the team's software development process and tooling.
  • Develop new automation strategies for sophisticated and growing distributed systems.
  • Have a strong interest in researching best practices in software development, and sharing new knowledge with the team.

Required Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Computer Science or equivalent course of study.
  • 1+ years of development experience in Python. Ansible experience is a plus, but not required.
  • Strong development skills including knowledge of object-oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals and design patterns.
  • Ability to work well in a team environment and have empathy for others.
  • Strong communication and problem solving skills.
  • Commitment to tackle challenging problems, and hungry to learn.
  • Care deeply about quality and the customer experience. Build elegant and simple solutions.
  • Adaptable to change, can operate independently and with initiative.
  • Evaluate ideas based on merit, and consistently work to generate customer value.

NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Would you like to join us at the forefront of technological advancement?

Join our Jarvis conversational AI team and help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field. Intelligent machines powered by AI computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a virtual assistant powered by AI can engage with human to answer questions and perform tasks. An AI-powered chatbot can learn conversation skills through trial and error. This is truly an extraordinary time. The era of AI has begun.

What you'll be doing:

As a Software Intern on our Jarvis team, you will be working on research, design and implementation of SW features in the Jarvis conversational AI and intelligent assistant. You will use machine learning, deep learning speech, NLP, and computer vision techniques combined with rules-based domain specification to build high performant conversational AI services with robust API interface for data center, cloud, and embedded platforms.

What we need to see:

  • Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science/EE or related

  • Strong fundamentals in embedded systems, programming and SW design

  • You have strong knowledge of ML/DL techniques, algorithms and tools with exposure to CNN, RNN (LSTM), transformers (BERT & GPT-2/3), NLP, speech, and/or Computer Vision

  • Shown ability to develop robust and efficient APIs (REST, RPC, GRPC) for machine learning model inference and managing related workflows.

  • Excellent fluency with C/C++ and Python

  • Strongly believe that prototyping is the right way to prove the idea

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • NLP, speech or audio processing experience is highly desired

  • Experience with building machine learning model inference pipeline as a service

  • Experience with deploying machine learning models on data center, cloud, and embedded systems

  • Background with one of the following: dialog systems and conversational platforms, computer vision, signal processing

  • Familiarity with GPU computing (CUDA, OpenCL, OpenACC)

  • Background with Dockers and Kubernetes

  • Familiarity with ONNX and TensorRT

  • Worked with variety of vision, depth and audio sensors

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: EDG Intern - Bachelor Computer Science Majors
description:
Looking for Spring & Summer 2022 Interns!

Interns in our Engineering Development Group gain hands-on experience in a welcoming environment that fosters and rewards innovation, teamwork, learning, and fun. You will make an impact by contributing to a real-world project and working with bright, passionate colleagues to push the limits of engineering and science. Increase your knowledge of software engineering, testing, and debugging while also developing valuable professional skills, such as written and oral communications, problem solving, and time management.


After training on MathWorks processes and tools, you will collaborate with a development team to implement updates for a future release of one of our 100+ products, or help develop automated tests to verify that features in MATLAB or Simulink are functioning as designed.

This internship will prepare you for a career at MathWorks starting in our Engineering Development Group (EDG).

Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

  • Strong academic record
  • MATLAB knowledge or experience is a plus

  • Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer without restriction.
  • Visa sponsorship will not be provided for this position.
  • Candidates must be pursuing a bachelor's level degree in a technical discipline.

Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Software Engineering builds the brains of Waymo's fully autonomous driving technology. Our software allows the Waymo Driver to perceive the world around it, make the right decision for every situation, and deliver people safely to their destinations. We think deeply and solve complex technical challenges in areas like robotics, perception, decision-making and deep learning, while collaborating with hardware and systems engineers. If you’re a software engineer or researcher who’s curious and passionate about Level 4 autonomous driving, we'd like to meet you.

It’s preferred if you have:

  • Experience with Machine Learning, Robotics, and or building Web Apps

We will accept resumes on a rolling basis until the role is filled. To be in consideration for multiple roles, you will need to apply to each one individually - please apply to the top 3 roles you are interested in.

About Citadel

Citadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For thirty years, Citadel’s hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.

With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel’s team of investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.

As we seek to become the most successful investment team in the world, we empower Traders to bring investment ideas to life. Our Traders identify opportunities in major financial markets around the world and take calculated risks. We succeed together in a team environment that facilitates close collaboration between Traders, Quantitative Researchers, and Technologists.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in trading through a structured program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Ken Griffin. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Your Objectives:

  • Develop in-depth knowledge of a financial market
  • Apply advanced statistical techniques to trading
  • Constantly learn and adapt trading approaches
  • Innovate by using one of the industry’s most powerful trading platforms

Your Skills & Talents:

  • Advanced training in Applied Math, Engineering, Statistical Modeling, Calculus, Computer Science, Physics or related disciplines required (bachelor’s, master’s, PhD Degree)
  • Ability to think about the world systematically and quantitatively, as well as the ability to deal with uncertainty in a rigorous and statistical approach
  • Interest in applying technology and/or quantitative skills to solve complex trading problems
  • Passion for the markets and a desire to seize investment opportunities
  • Experience with programming, scripting, and/or statistical software strongly preferred

About Castlight

At Castlight, our mission is to empower people to make the best choices for their health and to help companies make the most of their health benefits. We offer a health benefits platform that engages employees to make better healthcare decisions and can guide them to the right program, care, and provider. The platform also enables benefit leaders to communicate and measure their programs while driving employee engagement with targeted, relevant communications.

To date, Castlight has partnered with more than 240 large enterprise customers, spanning millions of lives, to improve healthcare outcomes, lower costs, and increase benefits satisfaction.

Description

Castlight Health’s Data Engineering team is seeking a summer intern based in San Francisco, CA. Come join us on our mission and help change healthcare for the better with a data-driven approach!

As an intern, you will have the unique opportunity to work with a team of experienced Data Engineers and Data Scientists building products that ingests large disparate sets of healthcare. The team is passionate about writing data driven applications, dealing with large sets of imperfect data, and designing scalable multi-tier systems to process it.

You will work with the team applying data and software engineering techniques working with data and infrastructure to scale our pipelines and automate our processes.

Internship Duration: May - August 2018

Internship Program Experience: In your 12-week internship, you will be paired with a mentor on the team. Expect to network with executives across departments, participate in intern-only events and programs, experience the Castlight culture, and have fun in San Francisco!

Qualifications
Pursuing a Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or related field
Experience with Python and SQL
Interest in data and data engineering
Computer Science fundamentals: object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design.
Demonstrated ability to work well as a member of a software team
Experience/knowledge of Airflow a plus

If you take this internship, you will work closely with both the founder as well as those in marketing and product/services management to define and develop streamlined workflows that will allow the company to efficiently apply, augment, and enhance what we offer both internally & across the web.

We integrate our interns as members of our Scrum/Agile teams where they participate in our weekly product / service planning meetings. We are looking for interns with experience in:

  • REST APIs: researching and implementing developer tooling
  • Product UI: sourcing and working with feeds (JSON/XML) that populate dashboards
  • Familiarity with AR/VR
  • Storage: cloud data storage and retrieval
  • Compute: distributed workload management and scheduling
  • Query: query language development and application
  • Deployments: systems to support continuous delivery and integration of new software features - across multiple platforms (mobile, desktop)
  • E-commerce: customer onboarding, billing integration, account management services

We will provide structure, definition of goals, process, relationships, community, and teamwork experiences to give interns the best chance to succeed at their projects

What You Bring to the Table:

  • In progress (Junior or Senior) or recently completed Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or participation in a relevant coding bootcamp, or equivalent work experience
  • Experience developing business applications using object-oriented programming languages (ie: Java, Python, PHP or Ruby) and experience with JavaScript frameworks like Angular, React, Node.js
  • Knowledge of MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
  • Experience with AWS / cloud platforms, including Kubernetes, OpenShift, Docker Enterprise, or Cloud Foundry in the public cloud
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You’re driven towards projects that have an impact on user experience
  • You are problem-solver who is interested in scale, efficiency, and performance optimization
  • Technical curiosity and a strong desire to learn and improve
  • A strong interest in creator content and/or the entertainment industry -- knowledge of the audience is helpful in these projects

Bonus points:

  • You have public code viewable on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You’ve developed visually appealing front end website architecture, including translating designer mock-ups and wireframes into front-end code
  • You’ve designed user interactions on web pages
  • You’ve developed functional databases, applications, and servers to support websites on the back end
  • You have a desire to leverage data and algorithms to improve the search experience for our users and customers.

We Want You to Have:

  • Excellent communication, problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills
  • Ability to present and clearly explain your work to others
  • Experience collaborating in multifunctional teams
  • Ability to set goals, socialize them for approval, and work quickly & independently
  • Affinity with our values, and a passion for creating products that meet people’s functional and emotional needs

What You’ll Get in Return:

  • Experiential Education: A rare hands-on opportunity to help launch two new platforms each with different focuses but across projects, you would have focuses in creator content, artist management, rights management, & AR/VR technologies.
  • Networking with a dedicated team of passionate and dedicated individuals in the space including music industry veterans to create life-long contacts and quality referrals within the industry.

Program Guidelines:

  • Internship dates: Summer - 2021

Why You Want To Work Here:

  • A small but collaborative and creative team
  • The opportunity to gain a further understanding of Agile music marketing models across platforms, campaign / activation planning via a regular (monthly) release schedule / calendar, and the marketing lifecycle from ideation to execution to measurement.

Weekly Responsibilities / Requirements:

  • Zoom video “Scrum”-type calls for weekly work Sprints (45 min – 1 to 2 times a week)
  • Proficient with shared project management apps: (e.g. - Slack, G-Suite (docs, slides, sheets), Asana, Miro).

Application Instructions:

  • Submit a resume/CV & short, concise paragraph stating why you’re interested in the opportunity, with links to your previous work / code projects / websites. Being detail oriented is key -- please check spelling and grammer. If there are any assessments, please complete them.

This is the primary project seeking the development at this moment, but happy to discuss the other opportunities on a call as well -- if you feel the multitude of portfolio builders and experience would be beneficial to you.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $1.00 - $2.00 per month

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • REST API and Having Set Up Advanced Integrations: 2 years (Required)
  • JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React, and Amber.: 2 years (Required)
  • Server-side languages such as Python, Ruby, Java, & .Net.: 2 years (Required)
  • Database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, and MongoDB.: 2 years (Required)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

position: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
description:
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Project:


The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP:


  • Culture of collaboration:     Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:


The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.


The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.


What you’ll do:


Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: August 2021 - February 2022


In this role, you’ll:


The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.


This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.


Who you are:


We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.


Responsibilities


  • Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
  • Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
  • Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
  • Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
  • Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
  • Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
  • Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
  • Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
  • Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
  • Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
  • Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
  • Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
  • Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
  • Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
  • Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
  • Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
  • Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
  • Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
  • Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
  • Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
  • Assist in the support of planning and project management.
  • Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
  • Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
  • Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
  • Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
  • Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
  • Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
  • Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.


Qualifications


  • General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
  • General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
  • General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
  • General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
  • Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
  • Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
  • Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
  • General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
  • General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
  • Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
  • Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
  • Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
  • Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
  • General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
  • General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
  • Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
  • Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
  • Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
  • Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
  • Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
  • Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.


Technical Experience


A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

  • Full-stack Development
  • HTML5/CSS3
  • JavaScript
  • JavaScript Frameworks
  • jQuery
  • DevTools
  • Responsive/Adaptive Design
  • Cross-Browser Development
  • Content Management Systems
  • Testing/Debugging
  • Git/Version Control
  • Bonus Skills:
    • Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
    • Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
    • Experience optimizing React applications.
    • Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.


Education and Professional Experience


  • In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
    • Computer Science
    • Web Performance Analytics
    • Full Stack Web Development
    • Front-End Web Development
    • User-Experience Design
    • Interactive Design and Media
    • Marketing & Business
  • Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
  • Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

The Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) team is a small, dynamic start-up team within Itamar Medical. The team was formed after the acquisition of assets and technologies of Spry Health, a startup based in Redwood City. We are developing the Loop System, an RPM solution which includes a medical device wearable sensor, the Loop Band, and a connectivity unit, the Loop Hub. Using our RPM solution, we aim to change how care is provided and drive better outcomes for patients with chronic conditions such as Sleep Apnea, Congestive Obstructive Pulmonary Disorder (COPD) and Congestive Heart Failure (CHF). Join our efforts to create effective solutions in the forefront of healthcare technology innovation.

Position Summary:

The Data Engineering Intern will assist in creating software infrastructure, pipelines, and tools to digest large volumes of data. They will assist in building research software intrastructure for clinical studies and evaluations. The Data Engineering Intern will get exposed to all aspects of the business and have a chance to leverage the benefits of a small, cohesive, cross-functional team. The person holding the position will report to our Head of Research - US.

Primary Responsibilities and Duties:

    Create software infrastructure, pipelines, and tools to digest large volumes of data.
    Implement web-based interfaces and decision-making tools to interact with data on a granular level.
    Deploy benchmarking tools for algorithms and methods.
    Build research software infrastructure for clinical studies and evaluations.
    Develop APIs for access to data and results.
    Integrate Python based algorithms and methods into cloud-based infrastructure.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

    Experience designing and implementing software tools and pipelines.
    Demonstrated experience interacting with APIs to push and pull required data for analysis.
    Fluent in Python and Version Control (Git, svn, etc.).
    Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP).
    Ability to quickly adapt and respond to job, environmental, and industry changes. Experience designing and implementing software tools and pipelines.
    Demonstrated experience interacting with APIs to push and pull required data for analysis.
    Fluent in Python and Version Control (Git, svn, etc.).
    Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP).
    Independent - can learn and gain new knowledge on his own.
    Must be able to communicate effectively & maintain professional conduct at all times.
    Organized, self-starter with the ability to handle several tasks and prioritize workload with minimal supervision.
    Able to work longer hours or after hours to support company needs if they arise.

Experience and Education Requirements:

    Pursuing M.S. or PhD (or Recent Graduate) in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related fields
    Minimum 1 year of industrial or academic research experience operating in a small team working with Python based data pipelining or big data infrastructure.

Supervisory Reports:

This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Itamar is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment will receive consideration without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, citizenship status or protected veteran status.


About Itamar Medical:

Itamar® Medical, Inc. is a fully owned subsidiary of Itamar® Medical Ltd. We are pioneers in creating and developing the PAT® signal technology which provides a non-invasive window to the cardiovascular and autonomic nervous system, allowing the monitoring and measurement of critical patient information such as sleep disorders and cardiovascular health. The company’s US Headquarters is based in Atlanta, GA. Established in 1997, Itamar® Medical Ltd., is a public (TASENASDAQ: ITMR), rapidly-growing medical technology company building its presence and footprint in multiple medical disciplines.

WatchPAT is an FDA- cleared portable diagnostic device that uniquely uses finger-based physiology and innovative technology to enable simple and accurate Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) testing while avoiding the complexity and discomfort associated with traditional air-flow based systems.

You have a unique opportunity to work with a world leader in the cardiology/electrophysiology medical field.

position: Wordpress Web Developer Intern- Remote (Credit Only)
description:
ABOUT US:

We are a startup marketing agency & cosmetic concierge, concentrating on fashion and beauty. We are in need of a writing/social media intern for our sites as well as for client sites. We are looking for a dedicated, consistent social media intern who is passionate about beauty and fashion and who is a go-getter, and can work minimum 20 hours a week virtually. The intern(s) should be relatively experienced in web development.

Although this is a non-paid internship we will be able to help you get school credit and promise you will learn alot.

Full Job Description

In this role, you will operate as a skilled developer, developing on WordPress CMS and HubSpot CMS-based websites. You will be responsible for working closely with our CMO to develop custom websites and other web solutions for our company and our clients.

Responsibilities

  • Work with a team in the production of high-quality and innovative websites, built on Wordpress
  • Adhere to production schedules and work under tight deadlines.
  • Enhance skillset overtime to keep up with modern UI trends and techniques.
  • Strong knowledge and proven work experience of WordPress (we will ask for samples)
  • Good understanding of website architecture and aesthetics.
  • An ability to work on multiple projects and tasks at the same time
  • Good communication skills.

Duties

  • SEO skills
  • Understanding of web design/word press
  • Creativity
  • Website maintenance

Job Requirement:

  • WordPress: 1 year (Preferred)
  • SEO: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Web Design: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Elementor & WP Bakery

Location: Remote, Work from home or anywhere else that is convenient for you. We offer internships year-round, with flexible hours and an upbeat work environment!

Time Commitment: Approximately 20 hours a week for 6 months

Compensation: This is an UNPAID internship, but you can get college credit and the experience is priceless! We also provide letters of recommendation, certificate of internship and the opportunity to network.

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Additional job responsibilities include validating accuracy of training procedures, writing and editing course content, and analyzing feature functionality. You will work closely and communicate with the product development team and Oracle University

Do you want to get a foot in the door and perhaps even get the chance to interview early for one of the best technology jobs in the world? If so, you may be an ideal candidate for our internship program.

Gain invaluable experience in what it is like to work at a leading global hardware and software systems innovator - Oracle. Your colleagues are industry experts and knowledgeable veterans. Your contributions will enhance real Oracle products and services. By the end of your internship you will be connected to a powerful network of professionals, managers, and executives.

Completed second year of undergraduate degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related area of study. Strong academic achievement. Strong interest in technical area of study.
